page.title: 04Our Old Caretaker
page.content: Mrs.North has lived in the schoolhouse since 1939.When she first came to live in Cheriton she had no electricity or outside toilet. Mrs.North has three children,eleven grandchildren and five great grandchildren. Her job was quite different from Mrs.Ford's,our present caretaker. She had to pump water for the school every morning from the well,fill and light paraffin lamps,chop firewood,light fires and carry heavy coal scuttles to keep them going. The school kitchen used to be her garden room and during the 1939-1945 war evacuees from Portsmouth lived there. Her husband was a bricklayer and worked at Freemans just behind the school.
